entries.name: Special
entries: You may not benefit from the rogue's Sneak Attack feature while using this weapon two-handed. This weapon can be chosen as a kensei weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may not benefit from the rogue's Sneak Attack feature while using this weapon two-handed.

entries.name: Special
entries: You wield this weapon without the use of a hand, instead using the foot the dagger is affixed to. You may only make one attack on your turn when attacking with this weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: While this weapon is sheathed, your hands are considered free.

entries.name: Special
entries: While wielding two gauntlets and no shield, you increase your Armor Class by 1. You can only benefit from this effect once.

entries.name: Special
entries: While you're wielding this weapon, you can still make a Grapple check. On a success, you grapple your opponent with the sickle-edge of your sword, keeping them locked and dealing {@dice 1d4} piercing damage at the start of their turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals {@dice 1d8} damage to environmental objects and creatures with the Plant type.

entries.name: Special
entries: When used as a Double Weapon, the Kusarigama gains the reach property.

entries.name: Alternate Name
entries: This weapon goes by an alternate name: Kusarigama.

entries.name: Alternate Name
entries: This weapon goes by an alternate name: Sto√üdolch.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you make an attack against a medium or large creature, you also attack any enemies directly to its left or right. On a hit, those creatures take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Headphones
entries: Headphones are a pair of earphones joined by a band placed over the head, for listening to audio signals such as music or speech. They can be connected using an audio jack attached to a wire (or ocassionally, through a wireless pairing mechanism known as bluetooth) in order to receive audio files from an output device (usually a smartphone, music player, or equivalent).

The volume of the output device can generally be adjusted in order to change the decibels at which the audio is played. Maximizing or near-maximizing the volume will result in the user being put under the {@condition deafened} condition, as they are unable to hear anything other than the audio pouring out from the internal speakers.

Headphones can be reskinned as earphones. If done so, their weight reduced by a considerable margin (generally anywhere from 0.01 lbs to 0.05 lbs). In addition, headphones that utilize bluetooth connectively require time to charge, similar to that of smartphones.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Smartphone
entries: A mobile phone that performs many of the functions of a computer, typically having a touchscreen interface, Internet access, and an operating system capable of running downloaded applications.
There are many things a smartphone has access to, which includes but are not limited to:

{@bold Communication.} Conversations using smartphones can be made across long distances, similar to that of sending stones. However, the difference lies in the ability to have full-length conversations back-and-forth through the digital wire. In addition, two smartphones do not need to be linked, and any smartphone in the world can be called by simply dialing another smartphone's number.

{@bold Networking.} Various applications can be accessed utilizing a smartphone, such as news apps that grant numerous amounts of up-to-date information about the world. This information, without a smartphone, would normally be gathered via bulletin or through use of a television screen.

{@bold Gaming.} Games can be played on smartphones, granting the user something to do when passing a large amount of time, such as when the party decides to take a short rest. Boredom on long trips is a real issue, you know.

{@bold Limited Use.} The main issue with smartphones are their limited uses outside of nations with proper wire networking such as Slecrotor and Zyraitix‚Äîwithout any cellphone communication towers, communication and networking is left as an impossibility (although games can still be played on smartphones without a connection). Smartphones will refuse to dial outside of their designated service range, usually a few miles away from a cellphone tower or equivalent.

{@bold Charging.} Majority of all smartphones are charged using a wired USB device that plugs into a wall socket or power outlet. In most cases, it is also possible to charge smartphones using a wireless charging device powered via spellstone known as a {@italic mana dynamo}. Many inns which serve out-of-state guests, specifically around populated epicenters for carousing and trade, will have these devices.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Flashlight
entries: Flashlights come in a wide variety of sizes and quality levels. Those covered here are professional, heavy-duty models, rugged enough to withstand the rigors of modern adventuring.
{@bold Penlight.} This small flashlight can be carried on a key ring. It projects bright light in a 10 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
{@bold Standard.} This heavy metal flashlight projects bright light in a 30 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
{@bold Battery Flood.} Practically a handheld spotlight, this item projects bright light in a 100 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 100 feet.
{@italic In addition, flashlights have multiple properties which make them unique:}

{@bold Battery Powered.} The majority of flashlights must be powered using batteries. A full set of batteries in a flashlight will allow it to last for ten minutes, after which the batteries must be replaced. You can purchase new batteries in any store that offers them, usually in technologically-adept nations such as Slecrotor and Zyraitix. Notably, battery flood flashlights require advanced batteries.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Standard Batteries
entries: These batteries can be used to power most items that state they require them. Any device that uses batteries comes with them. Different items require varying amount of batteries, shown by the following list:
{@bold Flashlights.} Penlight and Standard flashlights can be powered by inserting three standard batteries into their core, which last for ten minutes.
{@italic In addition, batteries have properties which make them unique:}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Advanced Batteries
entries: These batteries can be used to power most items that state they require them. Any device that uses batteries comes with them. Different items require varying amount of batteries, shown by the following list:
{@bold Flashlights.} Battery Flood flashlights can be powered by inserting two advanced batteries into their core, which last for ten minutes.
{@italic In addition, batteries have properties which make them unique:}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Chemical Light Stick
entries: This disposable plastic stick, when activated, uses a chemical reaction to create light for 6 hours. It illuminates an area only 5 feet in radius. Once activated, it can‚Äôt be turned off or reused.ss
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Gas Mask
entries: This apparatus covers the face and connects to a chemical air filter canister to protect the lungs and eyes from toxic gases. It provides total protection from eye and lung irritants. The filter canister lasts for 12 hours of use. Changing a filter is an action. The value for one extra filter canister is 6 gold.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Spike Strip
entries: This device is designed to help the police end car chases. The strip comes rolled in a spool about the size of a small suitcase. It can be deployed as an action by rolling it across a roadway, where it lies like a flat, segmented belt (at maximum it extends 15 by 5 feet). Until the strip is activated, the spikes do not protrude, and cars can pass safely over it. You can activate it as a reaction via a control device attached to the end of the strip by a 10-foot-long cord, causing the spikes to extend.

Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn‚Äôt need to make the saving throw.
Wheeled vehicles passing over the strip are automatically hit‚Äîalthough vehicles equipped with puncture-resistant tires are not affected.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Steel Handcuffs
entries: Handcuffs are restraints designed to lock two limbs‚Äînormally the wrists‚Äîof a prisoner together. They fit any Medium-size or Small human or other creature that has an appropriate body structure. You can make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against a grappled creature to attach the handcuffs to the creature, putting them under the {@condition restrained} condition.

These heavy-duty cuffs require a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 25 to break, and require a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (DC 20) to remove without the key.
Steel Handcuffs, upon purchasing, always come with a key, which can be used to unlock the handcuffs without a check.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Zip-Tie
entries: Handcuffs are restraints designed to lock two limbs‚Äînormally the wrists‚Äîof a prisoner together. They fit any Medium-size or Small human or other creature that has an appropriate body structure. You can make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against a grappled creature to attach the handcuffs to the creature, putting them under the {@condition restrained} condition.

These are single-use disposable handcuffs, much like heavy-duty cable ties. They require a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 20 to break, and require a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (DC 15) to remove. They can only be removed by cutting them off.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Recorder
entries: This small metal device fits in your hand like a charm, and is loosely equipped with a few functions, the primary of which allow its user to record the vocal utterances of another creature.

This device can record up to five minutes of audio without stopping, and while you cannot record more than five minutes, you can delete your previous recordings in order to free-up space. Whenever you finish recording a creature, ask your DM how much time elapsed to determine how much space you have left in your recorder.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

entries.name: Special
entries: A creature can remove a bola from an allied creature as an action. In addition, while a creature is grappled by a bola, they can fall prone. While prone, their speed is no longer limited by the {@condition grappled} condition.

entries.name: Special
entries: If your target is within 5 feet of you, it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: Enemies adjacent to you take an additional {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.

baseitem.name: The Beginner's Blade
entries: This decorated longsword appears to be a simple showpiece and not meant for battle. When sheathed at the hip of the wearer the hilt of the blade gives off a bright blue and gold shine.
While attuned to this sword the wearer is able to cast the following spells:

baseitem.name: Aci Feather
entries: While this feather is equipped on your person, you can use a bonus action to make your hair dramatically blow in a nonexistent breeze.

baseitem.name: Doom Box
entries: This simple wooden box, seemingly crafted with shoddy materials, creates {@dice 1d4} harmless spiders every week.

baseitem.name: Zingaro, the 10-Copper Mug
entries: This mug has a slot on its side, just large enough to fit a coin. Slotting in 10 copper coins will produce a mild-flavored ale or beer (accompanied by an arcade-style ding for each coin slotted in).
The coins vanish upon being inserted. In addition, the nearest establishment that sells beverages of the alcoholic variety will receive the money in the till or lockbox of their business.
The side of the mug has a simple logo: {@bold Zingaro}. Meanwhile, the bottom has been engraved with small, runic letters: {@italic "Zingaro, the beer for your generation".}

baseitem.name: Quantum Ring
entries: This ring turns invisible when worn.

baseitem.name: Quantum Eyeglass
entries: A white eyeglass that extend outwards 1-foot, decorated with strange gold markings. Looking through this glass allows you to see yourself as if you were looking at yourself from afar. It's often called the "Stalking Glass".

baseitem.name: Quantum Belt
entries: This dazzling belt reflects anything against the buckle with serene clarity, and cannot be smudged by even the grimiest of fingerprints. The buckle is shaped like a large letter "Q", and looks unnecessarily gaudy.

Toward the side of the belt is a small leather pouch, which can hold one type of kit by storing it in the Astral Plane. While inside this pouch, the kit becomes weightless and non-detectable by magical means.
Placing any item inside the pouch that isn't a kit will cause it to fall out, as the leather is ripped open from the inside out. After this, the belt ceases to be magical.

The pole of this sickly scythe is marred with scorch marks in crass patterns. The curved blade is an immaculate onyx with a soft purple orb glowing in it's center. Small arcs of violet plasmic energy crackle around the weapon.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. It has the following additional properties:

{@italic {@bold Doom}}. When you roll a 20 with this weapon, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. This does not work on constructs, undead, or other creatures immune to exhaustion. This exhaustion lasts until the charges are expended, the target takes a long rest, or the target dies.
{@italic {@bold Gloom}}. This weapon gains one charge for each successful activation of Doom up to a total of 6 charges. These charges last until your next long rest.
It takes one bonus action to activate charges 1-3 and a full action to activate 4-6.

rows: You gain advantage on ability checks for the next minute.
You gain double your movement speed for the next minute.
You gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws for the next minute and are concentrating on this effect.
You gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum HP total.
You cast the haste spell targetting only your self and are concentrating on it for the next minute.

For the next minute, the next attack that hits instantly kills the target. This does not affect constructs, creatures without a soul,  creatures immune to exhaustion, or creatures with legendary actions. Such creatures takes an extra {@dice 6d8} necrotic damage from the hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you make an attack against a medium or large creature, you also attack any enemies directly to its left or right. On a hit, those creatures take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Obsidian Weapon
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these obsidian weapons of demonic make.

These weapons deal {@dice 2d6} damage instead of their normal damage dice, and landing a critical hit with the weapon doesn‚Äôt double the weapon‚Äôs damage dice. Whenever you land an attack with the weapon and roll the same number on both of the weapon‚Äôs damage dice, you can immediately roll another d6 and add it to the weapon's damage dice.
You can continue rolling extra damage dice until you roll a number that does not match the previous rolls.
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Dress of Many Pockets
entries: This dress has many pockets. When someone compliments this dress, you can use your reaction to reply with "Thanks! It has pockets!" When you do, you can stick your hand into any pocket of the dress and pull out any mundane, non-magical, and non-consumable item of your choice. You can only pull out an item once per day per person that compliments the dress. Items pulled out from the dress disappear after 10 minutes.
{@italic "Nice dress, lil' missy," the old grizzled dwarf captain said, nodding to the halfling girl in a vibrant yellow sundress.}
{@italic "Thanks! It has pockets!" replied the little halfling girl, perhaps a bit too enthusiastically, as she pulls out a greataxe from her dress to demonstrate.}

baseitem.name: Circlet of Mispronounciation
entries: While wearing this circlet, despite their best attempts, creatures in your vicinity will incessantly mispronounce your name. The mispronunciations will generally rhyme with your name, with each's phonetic spelling only being slightly different
{@bold i.e:} Charles becomes Chairles, Charbles, and occasionally, Barblebee.

baseitem.name: Whistle of Duck Calling
entries: When you blow this whistle, a duck appears behind you. Once you blown on it, you must wait 5 minutes before using it again. Once used, any previous ducks summoned by this whistle disappears, and is replaced by the new duck.

baseitem.name: Stone of Healing
entries: This dull, gray stone is roughly the size of one's fist, and fits rather snuggly in the palm of one's hand. When a creature is struck with this stone, that creature takes {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage, immediately followed by healing for {@dice 1d4} health.

baseitem.name: Wand of Magic Chickens
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

Whenever this wand is used, the caster most roll a Wisdom saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, the caster must shout "BACAWK!" at the top of their lungs and squawk like a chicken. This effect lasts for only a few seconds, and the caster is aware of their actions the entire time.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

baseitem.name: Rocket-Propelled Broom
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs quite an amount (10 pounds), functions like a mundane (if unwieldly) broom until you stand astride it and pull the chord that acts as its kick-starter. It then launches into the air, with a lever at the side allowing you to rectify it into a hovering position.

It has a flying speed of 80 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes halved feet while carrying over 200 pounds. In addition, when attempting to move while overloaded, the rider must roll a d20. On a roll of 1, the broom falters as the rocket jams, causing you to fall at a speed of 30 feet per round until the broom is kick-started back up (requiring an action).

The broom cannot travel more than 60-feet above any surface, as the antigravity sensors on its lower ridge would malfunction, causing the broom to stall and fall at a speed of 30 feet per round before restarting itself after reapproaching its maximum height.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you so long as you can enter the coordinates in the planar transport module (a task which requires a successful Intelligence check with a DC 15. Seriously, who designed this thing?!). A failed save will result in your broom taking you somewhere {@italic a bit} off the mark, with the definition of "a bit" being up to DM discretion.

While flying on this broom, the amount of noise it kicks up as the rocket propels you forward and the engine hums provides ample opportunity for your presence to be discovered. Any item or spell that can remove sound (such as the silence spell) will block out this sound as it would any normal mundane item.
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Strom Headphones
entries: These, as the young kids call it, hip headphones are some of the most mainstream and popular brand around. They are a sleek black and come in over the ear and bud form. The younger generation of Zyratix considers these a must have when listening to music.

While wearing both halves of the headphones you are under the {@condition deafened} condition and listen to some cool jams. While deafened by these headphones you are immune to charm effects that require you to hear. You are still able to wear one and not be deafened.
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Nairek Boombox Mk. II
entries: This large contraption has a variety of knobs, dials, and sliders, with a certain instrument designed onto the back. It is often compared to it's smaller alternative, the remixer.

While holding this device, a creature can use its action to have Nayrek Remixer start listening. If anything within 30 feet of the device is performing with sound, whether using an instrument, singing, or something else, the ring can store the sounds of it provided it listens for at least five minutes. The Nayrek Remixer can hold up to 100 different "songs" on it.
As an item interaction the user may have a song playback. This music can be heard up to 100 feet away but can also be channeled through a pair of headphones and privately listened.

The user may also spend an additional item interaction to crank up the volume to max. While at max volume the distance the device can be heard extends 100 feet and any creature that can hear within 30 feet of the boombox makes concentration checks at disadvantage.
If in Zyratix, the user may upload songs from a central database rather than record them live.
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Nairek Remixer
entries: This simple metal box is about the size of a match lighter with a small display on its face, with a certain instrument designed onto the back. Often an item used by younger audiences to listen to music,

While holding this device, a creature can use its action to have Nayrek Remixer start listening. If anything within 30 feet of the device is performing with sound, whether using an instrument, singing, or something else, the ring can store the sounds of it provided it listens for at least five minutes. The Nayrek Remixer can hold up to 60 different "songs" on it.
As an item interaction the user may have a song playback. This music can be heard up to 60 feet away but can also be channeled through a pair of headphones and privately listened.
If in Zyratix, the user may upload songs from a central database rather than record them live.
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Akalizer Baton
entries: This fluorescent baton has an accented glow of a variety of colors ranging from blue, orange, purple, green, and white. It is one foot long but extends to roughly 3 feet.
While holding this baton the user may spend an action extending and constructing a motorcycle from the device. This has the normal statistics of a motorcycle with these adjustments:

items: It has a damage threshold of 10.

entries: {@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Flame-Enchanted Rifle
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon has been modified with magic runes. As a free action, the wielder may activate the runes on this weapon. While activated, the next attack does an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage, and if the attack hits a creature, it must make a DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. Once used this way, the rune becomes innert for 24 hours.

baseitem.name: Cloak of Cherry Blossoms
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to cause a small storm of harmless cherry blossoms to flutter around you.

baseitem.name: Through the Fire and the Flames
entries: These pair of gauntlets are shaped in the likeness of a dragon's mouth. You can cast the spell {@spell burning hands} once from each fist, for a total of two times, with a DC of 13. Once you use each fist this way, you cannot do so again until next dawn.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls using unarmed strikes with this weapon.

baseitem.name: Kindermore's Tincture of Disfigurement
entries: This vial of thick liquid of swirling greens and pinks holds one use of Kindermore's Tincture of Disfigurement. If applied to an area of the body, the tincture causes severe and painful acid burns that last for {@dice 1d4} hours. After 1 minute of severe pain, the wound begins to heal and the pain subsides. A disfigured skin scarification is in place of the skin that the tincture was applied to. The scars fully heal after {@di8ce 1d4} hours and the creature's appearance is returned to normal.

The tincture causes the target to take {@dice 3d8} acid damage. It's hit point maximum is also reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The effect cannot cause the target's maximum hit points to drop to 0. If it would drop to 0, the target instead is reduced to a maximum of 1, falls unconscious, and must begin making death saving throws.  At the end of the duration, the effects on a target's maximum hit points is removed and the target regains the lost HP.
The healing effect at the end of the duration does not occur if the creature dies. The healing effect of the tincture has no effect on constructs, undead, or inanimate objects.

The acid can be applied to the face in an attempt to disguise a creatures identity. A successful DC 20 Intelligence check  is necessary to discern the true identity. The effect does not end for the entire duration except through the {@spell regenerate} or {@spell wish} spells.

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Fire
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell scorching ray} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} fire damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Cold
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} cold damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Acid
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell melf's acid arrow} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} acid damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Lightning
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell shatter} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} lightning damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

baseitem.name: Stormcaller
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
You can speak the command word of this bow as a bonus action. After doing so, for the next minute, the bow and all ammunition fired from it are charged with magical lightning.
While Stormcaller is charged, you can point a finger to the sky and shout, "Strike!" as a bonus action to cause lightning bolts to strike down at any piece of charged ammunition.

All creatures sharing the same space as a piece of charged ammunition in the ground must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or take {@dice 1d10} lightning damage (or half as much on a successful save). Any creature with a piece of charged ammunition lodged in its body or armor automatically fail this saving throw.
Once a piece of charged ammunition is struck by lightning, it loses its charge. You can‚Äôt use this property again until you finish a long rest.

baseitem.name: Sigil of the Claw
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

baseitem.name: Sigil of the Claw
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

baseitem.name: Knave's Eye Patch
entries: While wearing this eye patch, you gain these benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
If you have the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, you are unaffected by the trait.
You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts or determine whether you are lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it.

baseitem.name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
entries: This armband appears to have thin {@item dagger|phb|daggers} strapped to it. As an action, you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

baseitem.name: Night Caller
entries: This whistle is carved from transparent crystal, and it resembles a tiny dragon curled up like a snail. The name Night Caller is etched on the whistle in Dwarvish runes. If a character succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill History}) check, the character recalls lore that says the {@creature duergar} made several such whistles for various groups in an age past.

If you blow the whistle in darkness or under the night sky, it allows you to cast the {@spell animate dead} spell. The target can be affected through up to 10 feet of soft earth or similar material, and if it is, it takes 1 minute to claw its way to the surface to serve you. Once the whistle has animated an undead creature, it can't do so again until 7 days have passed.
Once every 24 hours, you can blow the whistle to reassert control over one or two creatures you animated with it.

baseitem.name: Amulet of the Drunkard
entries: This amulet smells of old, ale-stained wood. While wearing it, you can regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink a pint of beer, ale, mead, or wine. Once the amulet has restored hit points, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

baseitem.name: Blood Spear
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using this magic spear and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points.

baseitem.name: Balloon Pack
entries: This backpack contains the spirit of an {@creature air elemental} and a compact leather balloon. While you're wearing the backpack, you can deploy the balloon as an action and gain the effect of the {@spell levitate} spell for 10 minutes, targeting yourself and requiring no concentration. Alternatively, you can use a reaction to deploy the balloon when you're falling and gain the effect of the {@spell feather fall} spell for yourself.

When either spell ends, the balloon slowly deflates as the elemental spirit escapes and returns to the Elemental Plane of Air. As the balloon deflates, you descend gently toward the ground for up to 60 feet. If you are still in the air at the end of this distance, you fall if you have no other means of staying aloft.
After the spirit departs, the backpack's property is unusable unless the backpack is recharged for 1 hour in an elemental air node, which binds another spirit to the backpack.

baseitem.name: Bottled Breath
entries: This bottle contains a breath of elemental air. When you inhale it, you either exhale it or hold it.

If you exhale the breath, you gain the effect of the {@spell gust of wind} spell. If you hold the breath, you don't need to breathe for 1 hour, though you can end this benefit early (for example, to speak). Ending it early doesn't give you the benefit of exhaling the breath.

baseitem.name: Paper Bird
entries: After you write a message of fifty words or fewer on this magic sheet of parchment and speak a creature's name, the parchment magically folds into a Tiny paper bird and flies to the recipient whose name you uttered. The recipient must be on the same plane of existence as you, otherwise the bird turns into ash as it takes flight.

The bird is an object that has 1 hit point, an Armor Class of 13, a flying speed of 60 feet, a Dexterity of 16 (+3), and a score of 1 (−5) in all other abilities, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.

It travels to within 5 feet of its intended recipient by the most direct route, whereupon it turns into a nonmagical and inanimate sheet of parchment that can be unfolded only by the intended recipient. If the bird's hit points or speed is reduced to 0 or if it is otherwise immobilized, it turns into ash.
Paper birds usually come in small, flat boxes containing {@dice 1d6 + 3} sheets of the parchment.

baseitem.name: Needle of Mending
entries: This weapon is a magic dagger disguised as a sewing needle. When you hold it and use a bonus action to speak its command word, it transforms into a dagger or back into a needle.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the dagger. While holding it, you can use an action to cast the {@spell mending} cantrip from it.

baseitem.name: Robe of Serpents
entries: A robe of serpents is a stylish silk garment that is popular among wealthy nobles and retired assassins. The robe is emblazoned with {@dice 1d4 + 3} stylized serpents, all brightly colored.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can transform one of the robe's serpents into a {@creature giant poisonous snake}. The snake instantly falls from the robe, slithers into an unoccupied space next to you, and acts on your initiative count. The snake can tell friendly creatures from hostile ones and attacks the latter. The snake disappears in a harmless puff of smoke after 1 hour, when it drops to 0 hit points, or when you dismiss it (no action required). Once detached, a snake can't return to the robe. When all of the robe's snakes have detached, the robe becomes a nonmagical garment.

baseitem.name: Robe of Summer
entries: This elegant garment is made from fine cloth in hues of red, orange, and gold. While you wear the robe, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you are comfortable as if the temperature were that of a balmy day, so you suffer no ill effects from the weather's temperature extremes.

baseitem.name: Seeker Dart
entries: This small dart is decorated with designs like windy spirals that span the length of its shaft.

When you whisper the word "seek" and hurl this dart, it seeks out a target of your choice within 120 feet of you. You must have seen the target before, but you don't need to see it now. If the target isn't within range or if there is no clear path to it, the dart falls to the ground, its magic spent and wasted. Otherwise, elemental winds guide the dart instantly through the air to the target. The dart can pass though openings as narrow as 1 inch wide and can change direction to fly around corners.

When the dart reaches its target, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} piercing damage and {@dice 3d4} lightning damage. The dart's magic is then spent, and it becomes an ordinary dart.

baseitem.name: Ring of Truth Telling
entries: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to determine whether someone is lying to you.

baseitem.name: Ring of Obscuring
entries: This band of iron resembles a skull and is cold to the touch. It has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. As an action while wearing the ring, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell from it, with the following changes: the cloud is centered on you when it first appears, and the spell lasts for 1 minute (no concentration required).

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: A weapon that has the burst fire property can make a single-target attack, or it can spray a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's normal damage. This action uses ten pieces of ammunition.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Concealed
entries: This weapon is not immediately obvious, and may be easily hidden or disguised as something else. A person attempting to locate the presence of this weapon must succeed on an {@skill Investigation} check opposed by a {@skill Stealth} check on the part of the character with the weapon equipped. Attacks with this weapon against creatures aware of you yet unaware of the weapon's presence are made with advantage.

entries.name: Double Weapon
entries: A weapon with this property may be wielded as one weapon, or as two separate weapons both considered to be light. When wielded as one weapon, the weapon may still be one or two-handed, depending on its other properties. A weapon with this property lists to sets of damage die with it, the first for the main-hand of this weapon, the second for the off-hand, and damage on both sides of a double weapon are the same as if it were wielded as a single weapon. Held as a double weapon, one hand or the other may have additional properties, listed alongside their respective damage die. Properties on the weapon (aside from two-handed) apply to both halves of the double weapon, as well.

entries.name: Grappling
entries: If a weapon has this property, an attack made with this weapon against an enemy in range of the weapon or within the weapon's reach may instead be made as a grapple. If the weapon carries the finesse property as well, the grapple may be made and maintained with a Dexterity check rather than an {@skill Athletics} check. If the weapon is ranged, the target's {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} checks to escape the grapple are made against a DC equal to 10 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Returning
entries: When a thrown weapon also carrying the returning property is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder at the end of their turn. The character must use their object interaction to catch the returning weapon, or it returns to the ground at the character's feet. When throwing a returning weapon, you can choose to not have it return in order to add 5 feet to its short range and 10 feet to its long range.

entries.name: Disarm Immune
entries: Any weapon that carries this property may not unwillingly be removed from your grasp while you remain conscious.

entries.name: Unarmed
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can choose to have the attack deal damage equal to the damage of this weapon, rather than your normal unarmed strike damage. In addition, your hands are considered free for the purposes of object interactions and grappling.

entries.name: Reload
entries: This weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the die roll is equal to or lower than the weapon's Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful {@item Tinker's tools|phb} check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at the quarter of a cost of a firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon's misfire score by 1.

entries.name: Ammo+
entries: This weapon requires advanced ammunition to fire, usually gunpowder, bullets, or magazines.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: On a hit, every creature within 5 feet of the target much make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer {@dice 1d8} fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so. Explosive weapons will also damage terrain (if applicable).

entries.name: Scatter
entries: Whenever you make the attack action, as a bonus action, you can cause your firearm to hit multiple targets. Make an attack roll against each creature in a cone equal to your firearm's normal range. On a successful hit, those creatures suffer damage as if you had attacked each of them (roll once). Firing this way increases your misfire score by 2 for that attack. You can only use Scatter once per round, regardless of how many bonus actions you may have. The Scatter property is unaffected by the Sharpshooter feat.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Reach
entries: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

entries.name: Reload
entries: A limited number of shots can be made with a weapon that has the reload property. A character must then reload it using an action or a bonus action (the character's choice).

entries.name: Thrown
entries: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries: This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

itemType.name: Artisan's Tools
entries: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

itemType.name: Gaming Set
entries: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

itemType.name: Instrument
entries: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.
Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

entries.name: Range
entries: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

itemType.name: Trade Good
entries: Most wealth is not in coins. It is measured in livestock, grain, land, rights to collect taxes, or rights to resources (such as a mine or a forest).

Guilds, nobles, and royalty regulate trade. Chartered companies are granted rights to conduct trade along certain routes, to send merchant ships to various ports, or to buy or sell specific goods. Guilds set prices for the goods or services that they control, and determine who may or may not offer those goods and services. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

entries.name: Crew
entries: A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function. As per the Player's Handbook, one skilled hireling costs at least 2 gp per day. The minimum number of skilled hirelings needed to crew a ship depends on the type of vessel.

You can track the loyalty of individual crew members or the crew as a whole using the optional loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. If at least half the crew becomes disloyal during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave the ship and never return.

entries.name: Passengers
entries: This indicates the number of Small and Medium passengers the ship can accommodate.
Accommodations consist of shared hammocks in tight quarters. A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers.
A passenger is usually expected to pay 5 sp per day for a hammock, but prices can vary from ship to ship. A small private cabin usually costs 2 gp per day.

entries.name: Cargo
entries: The maximum tonnage the ship can carry.

entries.name: Damage Threshold
entries: If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal. Any damage that fails to meet or exceed the damage threshold is considered superficial and doesn't reduce the ship's hit points.

entries.name: Ship Repair
entries: Repairs to a damaged ship can be made while the vessel is berthed. Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day and costs 20 gp for materials and labor.
Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.

entries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.

entries.name: Performance
entries: Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

entries.name: Compose a Tune
entries: As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.
Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.

entries.name: Components
entries: A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.

entries.name: History
entries: Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.

entries.name: Insight
entries: Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

entries.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.

entries.caption: Gaming Set
rows: Gain insight into an opponent's personality
